review: гамно
OUI !

[h1] ТОРТ ЦЕНОЮ В ЖИЗНЬ [/h1]

Да, вы не поверите, но Portal - первая игра от всеми известной и ненавистной студии, которая мне РЕАЛЬНО понравилась. Valve создали нечто большее, чем просто набор заковыристых задачек – они построили целый мир, полный загадок и намеков, где за каждой головоломкой скрывается мрачная история.

Геймплей строится вокруг портальной пушки – казалось бы, простого инструмента, но в умелых руках превращающегося в ключ к решению самых сложных пространственных головоломок. И головоломки, тут, далеко не такие простые, но и не сносящие башню.

Но за хитроумными головоломками скрывается гораздо более зловещая атмосфера. Лаборатории Aperture Science – это не просто место для экспериментов, это лабиринт безумия, где научные амбиции переросли в нечто чудовищное. 

Если бы Valve немного приглушили свой фирменный "юмор", Portal мог бы стать настоящим технологическим хоррором. Ведь по сути, мы играем за подопытную, которую используют для проведения безумных экспериментов. И эта осознание постепенно нарастает по мере прохождения, добавляя глубины и драматизма в происходящее (и тут даже можно закрыть глаза на то что она молчит).

Portal – это игра, которая оставляет после себя долгое послевкусие. Это головоломка, которая заставляет задуматься о цене науки, о границах человеческих возможностей и о том, что может произойти, когда технологии выходят из-под контроля.

Aquele "jogo obrigatório" que somente depois de jogar entendemos o porquê de ser obrigatório.

Particularmente até gosto de puzzles, mas o Burti de 10 anos atrás enjoava fácil e o jogo foi largado na metade. Transcorrida uma década, finalmente resolvi zerar o game. OK, é um jogo de puzzle, mas não é só isso. E tal fato só é revelado tardiamente no gameplay (apesar dos vários sinais, aos mais atentos). O que até então era "só puzzle" ganha novos traços de aventura e suspense. E, cara, legal demais zerar esse game!

Um jogo curto (cerca de 2,5h para zerar a campanha principal). O que pra alguns é um ponto negativo, para os casados-CLT-estudantes-pais é um baita de um ponto positivo. Viva os jogos curtos, bons e baratos!
I just know it is a banger!

Probably the least-liked or talked about episode among the three Half-Life 2 games since it primarily just serves as an example of Valve's idea on making episodic content, which didn't do very well as it was a very scaled down version of the previous entry with even less things to do and much shorter playtime. This was especially bad with the infamous development time that Valve has, since HL2 was released in 2004 and this game released in 2006- for, what, 2-4 hours of gameplay?

There are some nice elements to Episode 1 such as the Lowlife chapter which I actually liked, having to shine your flashlight at enemies for Alyx to shoot them and the general feeling of isolation and mystery given that you don't know what is going on at the surface. I also just simply like the parking lot architecture.

Other than that, it is just the Citadel and City 17 stuff again which you've already seen in the previous game.

The Last Stand of a Classic

Half-Life's multiplayer component represents both the charm and challenges of retro online gaming. While the community has dwindled significantly since its heyday, what remains offers a unique glimpse into FPS multiplayer history.

Community and Atmosphere
The Half-Life deathmatch community exemplifies old-school gaming culture at its best. Veteran players, many with years of experience, create a welcoming environment for newcomers despite the steep skill gap. This mentorship approach - where seasoned players offer genuine advice rather than toxicity - feels refreshingly rare in modern gaming.

During its more active periods (around 2013), the game maintained 5-6 populated servers, with Crossfire dominating as the map of choice. Custom maps, many ported from HL2DM, provided variety for those seeking alternatives to the standard rotation.

Technical State
The various iterations of Half-Life multiplayer exist in different states of health:

Classic HLDM remains the most stable, with dedicated servers still findable for those willing to search
HL2DM has seen recent updates and maintains both competitive and mapping scenes
Half-Life Deathmatch: Source (HLDMS) suffers from significant technical issues, including entity duplication glitches and problems inherited from engine updates
Current Reality
Today's landscape is sparse. HLDMS struggles with barely two populated servers, while classic HLDM maintains a small but dedicated following. The community has largely migrated to other titles or moved on entirely.

Bottom Line
Half-Life's multiplayer serves as a time capsule of early online FPS gaming - complete with tight-knit communities and technical quirks. While not viable for sustained modern play, it offers valuable historical perspective and occasional nostalgic fun.

Score: 6/10 - A fascinating relic held back by technical issues and dwindling population.

[h1]★★★★★★☆☆☆☆ (6/10)[/h1]

[i]Half-Life Deathmatch: Source[/i] (HLDMS) is essentially a 2006 remake of the popular [i]Deathmatch Classic[/i] (DMC) released in 2001, but now updated to the Source engine. 

I can’t say I ever saw this game popular. The trouble with this release is that it launched [i]after[/i] both [i]Half-Life 2: Deathmatch[/i] (2004) and [i]Garry’s Mod[/i] (2004). In fact, the same year it released we had [i]Garry’s Mod[/i] release as a full standalone package. 

As a result, this game had a small userbase and it proved to be very difficult to get people to shift away from DMC and other more popular, more advanced valve published titles for that time period.
